### hasImplicitOverlap() {#ac4ee35b1c961dfce1e567974b1cbb34d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MachineCopyPropagation::hasImplicitOverlap (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> &amp; Use)</>}>
Check that <code>MI</code> does not have implicit uses that overlap with it&#39;s <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a></code> operand (the register being replaced), since these can sometimes be implicitly tied to other operands.

For example, on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu">AMDGPU</a>:

V&#95;MOVRELS&#95;B32&#95;e32 VGPR2, M0&lt;imp-use&gt;, EXEC&lt;imp-use&gt;, VGPR2&#95;VGPR3&#95;VGPR4&#95;VGPR5&lt;imp-use&gt;

the VGPR2 is implicitly tied to the larger reg operand, but we have no way of knowing we need to update the latter when updating the former.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinecopypropagation-cpp/#l00496">496</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinecopypropagation-cpp">MachineCopyPropagation.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### hasOverlappingMultipleDef() {#afb6177425715be5c0c5dc4121a58cd54}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool MachineCopyPropagation::hasOverlappingMultipleDef (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineoperand">MachineOperand</a> &amp; MODef, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/register">Register</a> Def)</>}>
For an MI that has multiple definitions, check whether <code>MI</code> has a definition that overlaps with another of its definitions.

For example, on <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm">ARM</a>: umull r9, r9, lr, r0 The umull instruction is unpredictable unless RdHi and RdLo are different.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinecopypropagation-cpp/#l00497">497</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinecopypropagation-cpp">MachineCopyPropagation.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
